title: Fu'ivla Introduction
goal: Learn what fu'ivla are and their basic rules.

sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

co review:

djacu co glare co jinsa = ? (meaning)
Place structure from ? word

(Answers: hot clean water, the word before co — djacu)

New Material (5-7 min)

What Are Fu'ivla?

Fu'ivla are words borrowed from other languages, adapted to Lojban phonology.

Examples:

  • tcati — tea (from Chinese 茶 "chá")
  • kurki — cookie (from English)
  • kafke — coffee

Fu'ivla Rules

  1. Must contain a consonant cluster (CC)

    • tcati has "tc" cluster
    • kurki has "rk" cluster

  2. Must end in a vowel

    • tcati ends in "i" ✓
    • kafke ends in "e" ✓

  3. Preceded by a pause when after another word

    • mi pinxe la .tcati. (pause before tcati)

Recognizing Fu'ivla

Fu'ivla look different from gismu (which are exactly 5 letters in CVCCV or CCVCV pattern):

Type Pattern Example
gismu 5 letters djacu
fu'ivla variable tcati, kurki

Using Fu'ivla

Fu'ivla work like gismu in sentences:

mi pinxe la .tcati.

I drink tea.

la .kurki. cu glare

The cookie is hot.

Key Point

Fu'ivla let you borrow words from any language, following Lojban's sound rules.
sections.title: New Material (5-7 min)

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: Identify Fu'ivla

Which are fu'ivla (borrowed words)?

  1. djacu
  2. tcati
  3. kurki
  4. gerku
Answers
  1. gismu (5-letter root)
  2. fu'ivla (borrowed — tea)
  3. fu'ivla (borrowed — cookie)
  4. gismu (5-letter root)

Exercise 2: Use Fu'ivla

Translate:

  1. I drink tea.
  2. The cookie is hot.
  3. I want coffee.
Answers
  1. mi pinxe la .tcati.
  2. la .kurki. cu glare
  3. mi djica la .kafke.

Exercise 3: Combine with Week's Vocabulary

Translate:

  1. I drink hot tea.
  2. The cookie is dry.
  3. I want cold coffee.
Answers
  1. mi pinxe la .tcati. co glare
  2. la .kurki. cu sudga
  3. mi djica la .kafke. co lenku

Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Say aloud:

  1. "I drink tea." → mi pinxe la .tcati.
  2. "The coffee is hot." → la .kafke. cu glare
  3. "I eat a cookie." → mi citka la .kurki.

Today's Grammar

Fu'ivla rules:

Rule Example
Consonant cluster required tcati (tc), kurki (rk)
Must end in vowel tcati, kafke
Pause after other words la .tcati.

Summary

You learned about fu'ivla — borrowed words adapted to Lojban phonology. They must have a consonant cluster and end in a vowel.
